授業目的: This module is designed to provide students a deep understanding about global governance mechanisms and interaction patterns between actors from a global perspective. It aims to explain the historical background and the importance of global governance to tackle dilemmas that emerge across borders and affect the human life today. The role of international organizations such as the United Nations and non-state actors has been crucial in contributing to solve issues concerning armed conflicts, environmental disasters, pandemic diseases and so forth. In this context, the course also intends to develop a reflective learning on how stakeholders cooperate to mitigate and prevent those contemporary global issues analyzing the practices of global governance.
到達目標:
Students will be able to:
・Describe the notion of global governance from a global political perspective.
・Explain the historical background and the evolution of global governance in the contemporary world.
・Identify key elements to promote effective global governance by analyzing several case studies.
授業方法:
Classes will be conducted as type-A on-demand online classes (with a set timetable)
オンデマンドA型オンライン授業（時間割設定あり）で実施します

第2回: Overview and historical background of global governance
第3回: Theoretical basis of global governance and the IGOs
第6回: The UN organization and Security Council
第7回: Peace and security: Lessons on peacebuilding from El Salvador
第9回: Non-state actors: NGOs, Networks, and social movements
第12回: International human rights institutions and mechanisms
トピック.授業外学習2: Students are required to read books and articles related to global issues and international affairs (2 hours). Students are also encouraged to review assigned readings (2 hours).
